712308f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street - 2nd Avenue
712308f-a.text:
36th Street, north side, west from and including Second Avenue.
March 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712299f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712299f-a.text:
301 to 337 East 36th Street (foreground), north side, east from Second (left), to but not including First Aves., showing (left to right) the 4atory St. Gabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library (No. 303-305); the Hall of St. Gabriel's (R.C.) Church (No. 307-309); and St. Gabriel's Parochial School (No. 311-321). Also shown is a general view northward from 317-323 East 34th Street, a 12-story loft building, with the News Building (under construction ) on the south side of E. 42nd Street, between Second and Third Avenues, and several units of Tudor City across the background.
September 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr. '

707842f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707842f-a.text:
Second Ave., east side, north from East 36th Street. Note the Second
Ave. Elevated line overhead.
Octower 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707848f-c.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707848f-c.text:
Second Avenue, at the S.W. corner of East 37th Street, show ing tne prepwratory work on the future site of the entrance to the Midtown-uueens tunnel. Builcings occupyiug this, are being derolished. In the distance is the to ering Empire StatcBuilding.
May W7, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Snerr

712297f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712297f-a.text:
(1)
St. Gabriel's Hall, 307 East 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, with part of the park in the foreground. This building is sandwiched between the St.Gabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library, at the left,and the parochial
school, at the right.
March 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, three years later, showing children, and mothers wth
baby carriages, in the park..
April 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No's 1 and 2, and showing also a further view eastward so as to include the parochial school.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712313f-a.text:
East 36th St., south side, west from (No. 21E, three story building on left) a point between 2nd and 3rd Aves., and across the latter (elevated line thereon), showing a portion of that area known as Murray Hill. Note across the roof tops the Empire State Bldg.
March 27, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,

707839f-b.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707839f-b.text:
Second A2enue, west side, north from East 36th Street. At 37th Street is a V6Cant lot at the S.W. cornero This will be excavated for the entrance to the Midtown Queens
Tunnel.
Across thhe roof of the 4 story building at the N.W. corner appears the utilitarian News Building. Note
that these Views are one month apart.
View 1: May 26, 1939
View 2: June 28, 1939
View 3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707840f-c.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707840f-c.text:
Second Avenue, east side, IHOrth from East 36th Street, showing the cleared area extending to 37th Street. This is to be excavated for the approach to the new MidtownMQueens Tunnel.
Note the clearance at the far corner of 37th Street which opens to v;ew the rears of tenenents that face on 38th Strect. The 1d story apartment house, No. 3O1 East, is at the H.E. corner of this thoroughfare. To the right is the darlened side of tne New York Public Library branch. This
will be demolished in early 1940.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707841f-b.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707841f-b.text:
Second Avenue, north from East 36th Street, showing m.ainly the east side of this thoroughfare. En the foreground, and extending to 37th Street is a fenced clearance necessitated by the Miidtown-Quecns Tunnel plaza approach. The remaining structure is the St. Gabriels branch of the New York Public Library. This
is to come down early in 194O.
In the distance appears Tudor City. The apartment structure on the Avenue, is at the N .E. corner of 3B8th Street. This bears No. 30l East 38th Street and was
constructed in 1930.
May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

707843f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707843f-a.text:
Second Rvenue, east siue, north from E. 36th Street, showing in the foreground a row of buildings, prior to dcmolition (June) for the Queens Midtown Tunnel. These bear No's. 664 t 682 inclusive. Note just beyond the last enumerated structure a similar clearance at the N . E. corner of 37th Street. The apartment house seen is No. 3Ol E. 38th Street and is at the N. E. corner there.
January B, 1939
Somiach Photo SService
New nork Sity Sunnel Authority

707844f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707844f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, south from E. 37th to 36th Streets. These buildings shown,will be demolished for tunnel construction. In June of this year the only ones standing will
be the three at the far corner.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Bervice
New York City Cunnel Authority

712301f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712301f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, shoing St. Gabriel's Hall prior to demolition. This is sandwiched in between the branch of the New York Public Library fleft) and St. Gabriel's Parochial Schoel (right). The church is to the Iear of the latter and fuces on the south side cf
E. 37th Street. (W.v.)
January 12, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712305f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712305f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, east from Second Avenue, showing mainly the northwesterly corner of St. Gabriel's Park, viewed southwestward. Across same appears the New York Steam Go. plant (First Avenue) and buildings on the south side of E. 35th Street. To the left is St. Gabriel's zarochial School and a row of tenements, all of which are to be deriolished for the 38th Street tunnel approach.
January 8, 1939
Sorach Photo 9ervice
New York Vity Tunnel Authnority

view 1: East 36th Street, e. fr. Second Avenue, showing change in road level because of construction of

view 2: North from E. 36th Street on new road between First and Second Avenues. Note change in street level along E. 37th Street as result ofconstruction of Lueens Midtown unnel.

707836f-a.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of E. 36th Street, showing clearance for the Oueens Midtown Tunnel. The sole remaining structure at this date is the St. Gabriel's Branch of the New York Public Library and which is shortly to be
demolished.
September 20, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library

712298f-a.text:
St. Gabriels Hall, w/ Eact 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, with part of the park in the foreground. Ihis building is sandwiched between the St. Sabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library (at the left) and the parochial school (at the right).

712303f-b.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712303f-b.text:
East 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue (foreground), showing demolition for the pla2a
approach to the Midtown Gueens tunnel.
Standing intact in all views is the St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This is the last of the builonga re.aining on the "plaza" and it too will be
razed in early 1940.
Adjoining same and partially destroyed in the early views are St. Gabriel's HLall and Parochial School. To the extreme right appear buiidings on the east side of First Avenue, between 36th and 37th Streets.
Views 1-2 May 26, 1939
View 3 June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr
